attributes.action: Stop building on Essex countryside.
attributes.background: So many proposals are being put forward to build on our countryside and green belt land in and around Essex. We are losing all out beauty spots and it’s destroying the very thing that attracts people to Essex, the countryside. Wildlife is being affected and there is not enough infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Crime rates are increasing in Essex, police are stretched, doctors are full, roads are clogged and there are continual proposals to build more and more houses. Wildlife will deplete and all our walking paths and countryside will be destroyed.
This needs to stop!

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Prioritise brownfield development in law to protect our green belt and farmland: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Change the Green List.
attributes.background: U.K. is keeping Canadians and similar countries off the Green List. Put Canada and similar countries on it.
attributes.additional_details: Canada has a higher vaccination rate and lower case counts than both Britain and the U.S. but for some inexplicable reason, the U.K. is keeping Canadians and similar countries off the Green List of countries exempt from isolation on arrival. Why. Is this political because of U.S. trade?The Green List should be decided on vaccination rates and case counts not for political gain such as worrying about losing out on trade deals with such giants as the U.S. after brexit.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about which countries are on the green list for Covid-19 travel rules, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling for Canada to be added to the green list, but if you wanted other countries to also be added to this list, it would need to be clear on what basis you wanted this to happen.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Publish criteria for allocating countries to red, amber and green lists: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587003

attributes.action: Remove all travel restrictions for fully vaccinated/immune individuals.
attributes.background: Everyone who is vaccinated, or in any other way not infectious to the public, should be exempt from quarantine and any testing on arrival to the UK from a green or amber country.
attributes.additional_details: If somebody is vaccinated against COVID-19 or if somebody overcame COVID-19 in the past 6 months (antibody test/positive test result), there is no reason for these people to be tested or quarantined, if they come from a green/amber country, as they do not have the potential to carry a virus that they are immune to. Testing is too expensive, and it will be a waste of money for people, who are immune against COVID-19.

attributes.action: Bulgaria in the GREEN LIST for travel and holidays .
attributes.background: I want Bulgaria to be on the green list, because this country is very beautiful for travel and vacation.
attributes.additional_details: Put the Bulgaria in the green list soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make EV rapid charging providers install all 3 charging standards available
attributes.background: I would like the government to legislate that all charging companies must offer the 3 main standards of charging at rapid chargers . This must include CCS , ChaDeMo and AC type 2 mennekes at 3 phase 22kw minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to this because certain providers are installing DC only CCS and ChaDeMo chargers leaving us AC users with little access to AC rapid chargers .
I realise that AC is slower and so they can't make so much money from us on a charging session but if electric cars are to success it is no good making 18 month old cars obselete when it comes to public charging access. THIS IS NOT GREEN.
It is also worth adding that should the DC charging system fail , every electric car in the UK can charge from AC as that is what comes from the national grid. AC also acts as a fall back for DC owners as well as standard for charging of cars like the Renault Zoe for example.

rejection.details:
The charging options offered by EV charging providers is a matter for individual providers, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to restrict funding for the rollout of EV charging infrastructure to providers that offer these three charging options, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Maintain former Keighley college site as a large community green space.
attributes.background: Retain the former Keighley college site as a large green space, dramatically improving arrival into the town. Offering open space to promote well being, togetherness and a sense of community. Government to recognise the site as a community space and to not allow any construction upon the site .
attributes.additional_details: The former Keighley college site is now a large green space, dramatically improving the natural landscape upon arrival into the town . The site offer a huge opportunity to breath new life into the town and to be used to promote well being, togetherness and a sense of community .The site is owned by Bradford Metropolitan Council who have minimal interest in Keighley town centre. We call for the Government to recognise the site as a community space and to not allow any construction upon the site.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.bradford.gov.uk/your-council/epetitions/epetitions/

If you want the UK Government or Parliament to take action, for example to amend the legislation and policy framework which governs planning and development decisions taken by local authorities, you could start a new petition specifically asking for that action.

Some journeys that took under 10mins are now taking 30/40mins. The road markers should be friendly to all road users. Bus lanes should not be 24/7.

rejection.details:
Decisions about local bus lanes and cycle routes are a matter for local transport authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you are concerned about bus lanes or cycle routes in your area you should contact your local authority about this.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Remove guidance and funding for temporary traffic measures that cause congestion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552306

attributes.action: Don't Ban petrol and diesel cars, it won't save the planet.
attributes.background: Review the true facts and stop this false Green campaign against cars
attributes.additional_details:
• Banning petrol and diesel vehicles worldwide would deliver only 0.4% emissions savings at a vast cost to the taxpayer.
• Climate change doesn’t care about where CO2 comes from. Personal cars are only about 7 per cent of global emissions, and electric cars will only help a little.
• The hybrid car saves about the same amount of CO2 as an electric car over its lifetime.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/11/17/dont-expect-electric-cars-save-planet/

attributes.action: Extend the Green Homes Grant and provide free, certified training.
attributes.background: This petition requests the government extend the Green Homes Grant so that property owners can insulate and make their homes more eco-friendly thereby reducing carbon emissions. It also requests government provide free, certified training for tradespeople to increase training and certification.
attributes.additional_details: The Green Homes Grant is a funding scheme created by the government to help individuals insulate their homes and make them more ecofriendly. At present tradespeople are struggling to get the certification required to undertake the work recommended  in time for the March deadline.  By extending the scheme and providing free, certified training more tradespeople will learn ecofriendly building skills and more homes will be able to access the grant.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that the Green Homes Grant has been extended for an extra year: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/green-homes-grant-extended-for-extra-year

If you also want the Government to provide funding for tradespeople to undertake the necessary training to enable them to gain the accreditation to make improvements under this scheme, we could accept a petition requesting this.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Implement a tax on food packaged with any single use plastics
attributes.background: A tax on all food packaged with any single use plastics in order to persuade food suppliers to replace it with non-plastic alternatives. The tax should start low but increase over time to make plastic food packaging commercially unattractive. For example 10% in year 1, 25% in 2 two, 100% in year 3.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic pollution is a huge problem, and currently there is little commercial incentive towards change. Food is one of the markets where single use plastic is highly prevalent, yet alternatives exist - from traditional waxed paper, through to new technologies e.g. cellulose based packaging. The UK should be a world leader in the green economy, and this approach would help to drive investment in alternatives to our plastic-heavy economy.

attributes.action: Support an anti-litter awareness campaign
attributes.background: The easing of lockdown restrictions has seen some of the most beautiful scenic locations strewn with litter by members of the public who seem to have no thought or care for their actions. We urgently need the government to support a long term campaign to raise awareness of the impact of litter.
attributes.additional_details: For many years there has been a notable increase in the amount of litter being thrown with no thought of the environmental or financial cost. This change of attitude has culminated in scenic locations, green spaces and country lanes being strewn with litter. Those of us who lived through national campaigns by Keep Britain Tidy in the 1970s, can remember the impact and positive change that happened as a result. Now is the time for a new government backed campaign.

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked, resign or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.  

You might like to sign this petition calling for a public inquiry into the handling of coronavirus:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576

attributes.action: Stop housing developers building houses everywhere. Save YOUR local area!
attributes.background: Housing Developers are building a colossal amount of homes all over the UK. They are destroying towns and villages, overburdening the local infrastructures and destroying vital green space. Local councils need more power opposing this, and stronger rules are needed to protect these areas
attributes.additional_details:
Housing developers have the upper say in everything. Even if a plan is rejected by the councils, they are usually won on appeal,  costing the taxpayers thousands each time. County councils need to see the bigger picture and assess road surfaces and traffic. 
Roads are awful and gridlocked. Schools are full to bursting. In my area it is a three week wait for a GP appointment. Figures show 430 houses needed building between 2016 and 2019 - nearly 1100 were completed. Act now!!

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about new housing developments, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take about this. We can only accept petitions that request a clear action by the Government or Parliament.

We have published a related petition which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319314

You could also start a petition calling on the Government to require all new housing developments to be approved by the relevant local authority before they can go ahead, if that is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: HONOURS SYSTEM REVIEW reward all ICU NHS workers! Not the likes of Philip Green.
attributes.background:
Total top to bottom review of the honours system!
Only reward people who act with selflessness and compassion to OTHERS. People who commit themselves to helping others are the very backbone of this country. For far too long we have rewarded the rich & famous acting purely in their own interest.
attributes.additional_details:
Because I find it difficult to accept that society currently rewards 'celebrity' and the well heeled over people in our community who actually commit themselves to a good cause with prospects of little or no reward. A great example are all NHS staff in ICU units up and down the country NOW! These are the people we should hold aloft. These are the actions and values I hope my children can follow.
Make it a system solely for 'real' achievement, for the givers not the takers!

rejection.details:
It's not clear if you want the Governemnt to review the honours system, or for honours to be granted to specific people.

We could accept a petition calling for the honours system to be reviewed, as this is something the Government could do.

We cannot accept petitions that call for specific awards or honours, such as the George Cross, to be given to individuals or organisations, because we can only accept petitions about matters for which the Government or Parliament are responsible for.

There is an independent process for considering nominations for awards and honours, and advising the Queen on granting these, so it is not something the Government or Parliament can do.

The Government has announced that it is delaying Her Majesty The Queen’s Birthday honours list until the Autumn so people who have made a contribution to the fight against coronavirus can be recognised and celebrated: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/oliver-dowdens-statement-on-coronavirus-covid-19-20-may-2020

You can nominate someone who has made an exceptional contribution to the response to the coronavirus crisis in the UK for an award here: https://www.gov.uk/honours/nominate-someone-for-coronavirus-work

You may wish to sign these petitions calling for a similar action:

Award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

A medal to honour the fortitude of people working in essential occupations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308035

Award medals to the retired doctors and nurses who returned to NHS for COVID19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315329

Award posthumous medals to NHS and other frontline workers; victims of covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312389

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.background: Stop  the Green levy on all energy bills, on £3000.00 £1250.00 Tax, for Petrol every 4.5 litres ( 1 gallon ) cost £10.00 tax £8.00 , cut the price £0.70p to £1.30p per litres this will bring inflation down.
attributes.additional_details: We have Oil in the North Sea drill for it. Gas frack for it, Coal open the mines. We are self sufficient in all of the above, it will take 40 years to build Nuclear power stations to supply the whole of the U.K. Wind farms only last 10 years only run at 50 percent can't store energy useless, solar farms only work well in the Summer. Stop lying to the people, have you learned nothing in the last few years relying on other Countries. Make the U.K. Great again build it all in the U.K.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Suspend the green levies on domestic fuel immediately:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

End the ban on fracking: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608745

Commit to UK natural gas and increase investment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608274

The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

attributes.action: Make all businesses show a recycling traffic light system on their packaging
attributes.background: They need to force companies to make ALL packaging show a traffic light system to assist people in how they should recycle packaging. I.e., GREEN = RECYCLE AT HOME. AMBER = RECYCLE AT LARGER STORES. RED = CANNOT BE RECYCLED. It should also show which parts of multi packaging come under which colour.
attributes.additional_details: It's currently incredibly difficult to see whether packaging can be recycled at home, at larger stores, or not at all, because there is no clear indication. Therefore, people can't tell if they can recycle their rubbish or not, and many items get wrongfully put in rubbish bags heading for landfill in error. Clearer indication with a traffic light system will help people recycle more items and lessen landfill waste. It will also highlight which companies need to do more to change their packaging.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new requirements for labelling on packaging, but the types of household waste collected for recycling varies by local authority, so it wouldn't be possible for producers to say whether packaging can be recycled at home.

attributes.action: End net zero and green levies on our energy bills.
attributes.background: Net zero is being paid for by inflating our gas and electricity bills. Wind turbines are NOT FREE. We are all paying for them. We the tax paying people were never asked if we wanted to go green.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the government to reduce our energy bills instead of throwing millions into fuel poverty by paying for expensive unreliable energy. When the wind doesn't blow and the sun has gone down renewable energy is useless. The energy we use should be reliable and cheap. Our energy should come from North Sea gas and oil and be refined here in the UK.
We also need to increase our capacity for refining gas and oil.
The transition to green energy should be natural as it gets cheaper in the future.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the cost of decarbonising the UK's electricity supply, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make to current policy. It's not clear if you want the Government to abandon all policies to reduce carbon emissions in the UK, or just green levies on fuel.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend the green levies on domestic fuel immediately: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Scrap Energy Standing Charges
attributes.background:
Remove the standing charges from energy bills. These charges have increased heavily recently.
Costs to cover failed companies and green energy plans should be linked to consumption.
attributes.additional_details: When people reduce their use to save money, they still pay a heavy amount due to the standing charges. These are paid by all, regardless of how much, or how little, energy is used. This makes it hard to reduce bills, even when cutting back on usage. Standing charges are unfair.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Give all Care in Community Staff Green Badges for parking
attributes.background: Issue Green Care Badge for free parking whilst Carers in Community are working allowing them to park whilst attending to vulnerable people in their homes. Helping Carers do their job otherwise if nowhere to park and they have to park on yellow lines, they get fined!
attributes.additional_details: Carers in the Community are on tight schedules looking after the vulnerable in their homes and go from one resident to another to help them stay in their homes. Time is crucial to aid one resident and then go on to another and if no parking or carer cannot park anywhere then they get late for their vulnerable residents that they look after and also if there is only an area to park which is permitted or yellow lines, then carer is fined for trying to do their job and this is wrong!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to make it easier for carers to park, but we're not sure exactly what rights you want the Government to give people issued a "Green Badge" for parking.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make energy use more sustainable.
attributes.background: Energy companies have to be banned if they do not use sustainable energy. Companies should be more sustainable. Please sign this petition to help the world be more green, allowing people to be more healthy and happy.
attributes.additional_details: Most companies around the UK are in the position to do so. Companies just want money and do not care about the world, but the reason companies are there are to make the world easier. They are not.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about energy sustainability, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Many energy companies are not responsible for energy generation, and even customers on green tariffs will receive electricity that is not generated by renewables. It's therefore not clear which energy companies you want to be banned, or if what you actually want is for all non-renewable energy generation in the UK to be banned.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Change Unleaded Fuel back to E5
attributes.background: E10 fuel was introduced to balance the green agenda, however it is far from green with fuel efficiency dropping by circa 25% in some modern vehicles with an average of 10% across the board. E5 fuel should be reinstated, or vat be adjusted to counter the demise in MPG.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should either reduce vat on high ethanol content fuel that reflects the poor efficiency it gives, or revert back to E5 blend. It cannot be considered greener than E5 if the average person is getting 10% less mpg out of it. 

In addition high fuel prices are crippling right now and it is double whammy for the motorist but a windful in VAT receipts.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the replacement of E5 unleaded petrol with E10. However it's not clear whether you want the Government to overturn the decision to replace E5 with E10 unleaded fuel, or for VAT to be changed by a certain amount, or for something else.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a related action: 

'Mandate standard fuel be ethanol-free & allow lower VAT for fuel with ethanol': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/604051

attributes.action: Stop renewable wholesale energy prices being set to gas wholesale prices.
attributes.background: The renewable energy price is dictated by the “last unit coming onto market, which is gas”, So while the cost of wind, the cost of nuclear and the cost of solar have not changed, the entire renewable market is getting a price based on gas. It’s ludicrous that green energy is priced by a fossil fuel.
attributes.additional_details: Renewable energy should be priced at percentage above cost of production.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about energy prices are a matter for generators and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament. The energy price cap set by Ofgem does not apply if a consumer has chosen a standard variable green energy tariff.

attributes.action: Axe assessment for pip England and replace with a newdisability benefit for life
attributes.background: Axe assessments for pip in England and replace with a new disability benefit for life after only one assessment as recommended by the new green paper that was published and to fix the flawed system that way disabled people don’t feel like their being treated badly and affect their health
attributes.additional_details: Axe assessments for pip in England and replace with a new disability benefit for life after only one assessment as recommended by the new green paper that was published and to fix the flawed system that way disabled people don’t feel like their being treated badly and affect their health

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about PIP assessments, and want the Government to introduce a new single health and disability benefit. However it's not clear who you want to be eligible for this benefit, nor how you want applicants' eligibility to be assessed. 

You could have a petition calling on the Government to replace PIP with a single lifetime benefit for applicants, so long as it makes clear how you want applicants' eligibility to be assessed, and how you want the value of this benefit to be calculated.

attributes.action: Axe pip to adult disability payment like Scotland across to England to be fair
attributes.background: Scotland approved changes to pip to adult disability payment introduction this year and only having one assessment for your life on your disability the green paper published for pip England also highlighted this issue and the same needs to be approved inEngland to make disability people life better
attributes.additional_details: After Scotland approved changes to pip to adult disability payment introduction this year and only having one assessment for your life on your disability the green paper published for pip in England also highlighted this issue among other things and the same needs to be approved in England to make disabilities people have life better and equally treated across the board as the system currently not fit for purpose and currently  discriminate against conditions people have

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Adult Disability Payment is not being introduced in England, so we're not sure what assessments you want to be stopped in England.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Devolve powers to councils to set their own housing targets
attributes.background:
Councils are too often faced with housing targets that can only be achieved by concreting over significant amounts of green space, with massive damage to the environment and quality of life.

Central government calculations play too large a role in determining local housing needs and numbers.
attributes.additional_details:
We call for: 

- Greater powers for councils to determine their own housing needs and numbers, free from the influence of centralised calculations

- New policies to provide stronger protection for greenfield sites and prioritisation of brownfield development

- Support for those seeking to deliver truly affordable housing, such as community land trusts

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want Government targets for local housebuilding to be scrapped or something else. We're also not sure what 'new policies' and 'support' you'd like to see. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Pass a windfall tax on gas and energy firms such as Shell and BP.
attributes.background: BP and Shell have reported profits of $12.8bn and $19.3bn. There has been no significant tax on these profits.
attributes.additional_details:
Investment in clean energy by oil and gas companies was about 1% of their capital expenditure in 2020, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA)
BP reported a profit of $12.8bn (£9.4bn) for last year, following Shell’s announcement last week of $19.3bn in profits. 
BP has paid no tax on its North Sea oil and gas for five years.

The thinly veiled excuse of using the capital to reinvest into green energy is unjustifiable as they would have already been committed to these projects regardless. There is no way to make them accountable for a non contractual premise and these companies are still investing in gas and oil exploration which would be disingenuous with the global climate targets to prevent a temperature rise above 1.5C.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions which call for actions with regard to named individuals, organisations or businesses, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

attributes.action: Remove green levy’s from household bills and rely on private investment.
attributes.background:
Remove green levy’s from household bills, there is enough market interest in sustainability, and the environment to maximise the opportunity through the private sector.
Allow the private sector to fund and drive forward net zero and increase renewable energy sources
attributes.additional_details: To release the tax/bill payer from the the cost of investing without a return, others are profit making on the tax/bill payers mandatory payments.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Stop energy suppliers who get 100% from renewable sources inflating their prices
attributes.background:
Ensure that Electricity Price Capping reflects a green energy strategy and supports the users who always choose providers using renewable sources.
The price of gas cannot be a reason to increase the price of energy from renewable sources
attributes.additional_details: The renewables industry is full of private investors all claiming that prices of electricity from wind, solar, tide or other sources that belong to us all, will reduce over time. Government and or Parliament needs to recognise at the domestic / residential level the choice we have made to be "Green" and prevent profiteering.

rejection.details:
The prices charged for the use of energy by domestic customers, within the limits allowed by the energy price cap, are a matter for individual utility companies, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to create a renewable energy price cap, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Get all long term rental tenants  double glazing to save on energy costs.
attributes.background: The Green Energy bill was too difficult to negotiate, our landlords are property rich and cash poor, we don't want to move after 21 years, but we would like double glazing as it is an old property, no point in offering storage heaters and loft when heat is lost through windows.
attributes.additional_details: Currently a log burner is being used, not eco friendly not good for the environment, but the storage heaters lose all their heat and blow all day running up fuel costs we can't afford due to heat loss, so we don't run them. It's the environment or we get cold. We need new Windows now, not just for home owners for long term tenants.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about replacing the windows in rental are a matter for the landlords, not the Government or Parliament.

You can find out about landlord responsibilities for improvements in your home here: https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/repairs/landlord_responsibilities_for_improvements_in_your_home

attributes.action: Remove Tfl Ulez compliant cameras in poor communities in South East London
attributes.background: Government approach to address air pollution in communities can not be generalised as communities differ in terms of their needs. I will enjoin Government to do the following in poor communities to address air pollution and improve quality of lives of the inhabitants.
attributes.additional_details:
1. A campaign that will encourage green building 
2. A campaign that will encourage people to ride a bike or walking instead of driving.
3. A campaign that will encourage taking a bus or carpooling. 
4. A campaign that will promote the use of energy efficient light bulbs and appliances. 
5. A campaign that will encourage people to turn 6. Government should focus on renewable fuel 
6.A campaign that will encourage people to buy fewer things that are manufactured using fossil fuels.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the ULEZ and local advertising for public transport are a matter for Transport for London and the London Assembly, not the UK Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to run national campaigns on some of the things you outline in your list.

attributes.action: Cut fuel duty tax.
attributes.background: Cut fuel duty to lower the price of petrol  diesel and other fuels primarily used to heat homes and for transport.
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of living is rising for every household in the uk currently. The decision for many to either put fuel in the car or food on the table is a decision no household should have to make. The government should look at rasing the money earned from other areas. Such as a rise in green tax for big business, or a Robin Hood style tax on the rich. 

With countless families slipping below the poverty line the ability to afford there heating bill would be one less issue for the future aswell.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

attributes.action: Ban all hamster cages under the minimum of 80cm by 50cm!
attributes.background: We can all agree that some of the cages out there for hamsters is shocking and too small for a permanent home. I'm starting this petition to keep the minumum of 80cm by 50cm and ban all cages below this minumum.
attributes.additional_details: Wood Greens Animal Sanctuary minimum is 80cm by 50cm, here is the link to show this:  https://woodgreen.org.uk/pet-advice/article/introduction-to-hamsters#:~:text=The%20ideal%20size%20is%20an,with%20a%206mm%20bar%20spacing. cages that are too small can cause a huge amount of stress and is cruel... Help raise the minimum of hamster cages to 80cm by 50cm.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: 

Require a minimum size for hutches and cages for animals:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597222
